title: Normal and abnormal neurologic function in infancy
creator_credit: Dept of Pediatrics, Ohio State University
brief_description: This film is designed to illustrate how infant motor function can provide a valuable diagnostic tool for early detection of intellectual impairment. Employing extensive clinical footage, the filmmakers have sought to depict characteristic defects of co-ordination where these exist either independently of, or as a result of, childhood brain injury.
